name: Parker Weil
blurb:
Parker Weil is the Vice Chairman of Investment Banking at Cowen. He has over 30 years of experience providing M&A advice and capital raising services to companies in the manufacturing, energy & power and business services industries.

At Cowen he leads the Strategic Capital Group which manages the firm’s relationships with Private Equity firms, Family Offices, Venture Capital Firms, Sovereign Wealth Funds and Independent Sponsors.  Mr. Weil currently serves on the Board of Directors of 180 Degree Capital Corp. and the Kellogg Finance Network. He has also served on the board of trustees of the Ridgewood Lacrosse Association, Maroons Soccer Club and Ridgewood Education Foundation. Mr. Weil holds a BA in economics from the University of Pennsylvania, and an MBA from the Kellogg Graduate School of Management at Northwestern University.

name: Bruce Hernandez
blurb:
Bruce Hernandez is a founding partner of Spire Capital, having been with the firm since its inception in 2000. Bruce plays an active role in both sourcing and overseeing portfolio company investments and also works closely with the firm’s Chief Financial Officer in fund administration.

Prior to co-founding Spire, Bruce was the managing partner of Waller-Sutton Media Partners, a private equity firm focused primarily on the media and communications industries. Prior to Waller-Sutton, Bruce served in a number of operational roles. As Chief Financial Officer of Horizon Cellular, Bruce was responsible for all financial operations of this private equity backed wireless carrier and oversaw its sale for approximately $600 million. Bruce also served as Vice President-Finance of a middle market cable television and wireless telephone operator.

He received a Bachelor of Science degree in business administration from the University of Vermont and a Masters in business administration degree from New York University.

Bruce currently serves as Chairman of the Board of Surgent Professional Education and NetFortris. Bruce previously served as Chairman of the Board of Performance Assessment Network and Director of American Community Newspapers, Apex Site Management, Ariston Global, Certiport, Choice One Communications, Encoda Systems, Just Marketing International, Nassau Broadcasting Partners, Rainbow Child Care Centers, Sonitrol, and Orcom Solutions.

Bruce believes that “life is too short for bad gear” be it cars, bicycles or skis.

name: Marissa Paragano
blurb:
Marissa Paragano is currently Vice President of Digital at JPMorgan Chase & Co in New York City, where she is responsible for helping drive digital strategy and innovation for the firm’s consumer bank.

Prior to joining JPMorgan Chase earlier this year, Marissa developed Goldman Sachs’s digital finance strategy for its then-nascent consumer-facing Marcus segment.

Previously, as Assistant Vice President of Digital Apply for Synchrony Financial, she directed the product strategy and execution for >30% of credit application volume, and led a multi-year strategic initiative to combine legacy mobile and desktop channels into a single adaptive responsive site. In that role, she also oversaw the rebranding effort of 20+ of the firm’s mobile credit application sites from GE Capital Retail Finance to Synchrony Financial upon its initial public offering in 2014.

Marissa has been quoted in multiple publications including Business Insider, and owned the strategy of the mApply platform cited as the driver of Synchrony’s induction into the InformationWeek Elite 100.

Marissa holds a Master of Business Administration dual-focused in Digital Strategy and Entertainment, Media & Technology from New York University’s Stern School of Business and a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration from Babson College. Outside of work, Marissa enjoys golf, distance running, and real estate investing.

name: Nicole Piasecki
blurb:
Nicole Piasecki is currently a senior advisor at Mitshubishi Heavy Industries, a member of the board of directors at British Aerospace Systems, a director of the US forestry products group at Weyerhaeuser, and chair of the board of trustees of Seattle University.

Until September 2017, Nicole Piasecki was Vice President and General Manager of the Propulsion Systems Division of Boeing's commercial aircraft business.   During 25 years with The Boeing Company, she held a number of senior roles, including Senior Vice President - Business Development & Strategic Integration and Vice President of Business Strategy and Marketing for Boeing Commercial Airplanes.  She also served as President of Boeing Japan.

Piasecki formerly served on the Federal Aviation Authority's Management Advisory Board, the US Department of Transportation's Future of Aviation Advisory Committee and the Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco's Seattle branch.  She is a graduate of Yale University and The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, and also studied at Keio Business School, Japan.

name: Quyen Tran
blurb: Ms. Tran joined in 2018 to help lead external fundraising initiatives for Two Sigma's private investments activities. Prior to joining, Quyen was a Principal at Jaguar Growth Partners, a real estate private equity firm focused on emerging markets. She was responsible for investor relations and fundraising for the firm’s inaugural fund. Previously, Quyen was a Director of Marketing in the asset management division at Perella Weinberg Partners where she focused on client relations and product development of the firm’s hedge fund strategies and product specialization for the firm’s Global Macro strategies. Prior to Perella, Quyen was a Product Specialist and Sales Manager at Och-Ziff Capital Management LLC, where she was responsible for marketing the European-focused and dedicated credit funds. Previously, Quyen was at Highbridge Capital Management as a Vice President of Business Development and Client Portfolio Manager/Product Specialist. Quyen started her career as an Investment Banking analyst in the Equity Capital Markets group of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. Quyen received a B.A. in Economics, with a concentration in International Finance, and a B.A. in French from Dartmouth College. She also earned the Chartered Alternative Investment Analyst (CAIA) designation.

name: Michael Cherny
blurb: Michael Cherny is a Healthcare Technology & Distribution Analyst at Bank of America Merrill Lynch. Before joining Bank of America in 2017, Michael was a Managing Director and Analyst on ISI Group LLC’s health care services and technology research team, covering the health care technology and distribution/life science tools and diagnostics sectors (having joined in 2012). Before that, Mr. Cherny spent six years at Deutsche Bank Securities as a Research Analyst on the health care services and technology research team. He began his career at Bank of America in the global health care investment banking group. Mr. Cherny graduated from the Goizueta Business School at Emory University with highest honors in 2004 with a bachelor’s in business administration.

name: Caroline Weakland
blurb: Ms. Weakland is an Associate at Sun Capital Partners in New York. Prior to joining Sun, she worked as an Analyst at Houlihan Lokey and SunTrust Robinson Humphrey.

name: Irina Bit-Babik
blurb:
Ms. Bit-Babik joined the Penn Office of Investments in 2018 and currently works with the private equity team.

Ms. Bit-Babik holds a BA from the University of Pennsylvania.

name: Raouf Tawfik
blurb:
Raouf joined Penn's Office of Investments in 2019 and currently focuses on the real estate investment program for the University's endowment and pension plans.

Raouf holds a BS from The Wharton School and a BSE from Penn School of Engineering and Applied Sciences.

name: Femi Palmer
blurb: Olufemi Palmer is a senior at the University of Pennsylvania pursuing a degree in Mathematics and Economics.  He has experience in several sales roles, working at a startup, and interning at finance and consulting firms.  He has worked at Bain, Credit Suisse, and Morgan Stanley, as well as a few other companies.  Through his professional and educational experience, he has developed a passion for entrepreneurship and technology.

name: Rachel Brenner
blurb: Rachel Brenner is a Junior at the University of Pennsylvania's Wharton School of Business studying Finance and Business Analytics.  She has work experience at Citi, BCG, Next Management, the Marks Family Writing Center (as a Writing Tutor), and at the Wharton School (as a TA), along with a few other companies.  Rachel will be working at BCG this coming summer.

name: Mark Shtrakhman
blurb: Mark Shtrakhman is a senior at the University of Pennsylvania pursuing a bachelor's degree in Economics with a minor in Mathematics.  Mark has had involved himself in numerous on-campus clubs and activities, including the Penn Wharton Public Policy Initiative Student Group, Academic Research, the Sigma Phi Epsilon Fraternity, and the Daily Pennsylvanian newspaper.  He also has work experience at factcheck.org, the U.S. Department of the Treasury, Barclays, and the Wharton School (as a Research Assistant).  Mark will be returning to Barclays after he graduates.

name: Sean Egan
blurb: Sean Egan is an analyst in Wells Fargo's Technology, Media, and Telecommunications group, and a recent graduate of the Wharton school.  In this roundtable, he gave our members an inside scoop on what it's like to work in IB, his recruiting experience, his career path, and his work-life balance.
